summary: Alan B Hausman is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) based on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. The documents list Hausman's name, position, and salary details during this period. The consistent appearance of his name across these documents indicates his sustained employment with the committee during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Alan B Hausman's significance lies in his role as a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his work is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll and certification reports confirms his involvement in the committee's activities.
